title: Lessons from the Relationship Between Lord Rama and Sri Hanuman | Sri Sampati Dasa
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

He entered Lanka to locate Mother Sita.

He's a happy being servant.

What lesson we learn from the relationship between Hanuman and Lord Shri Ram?
Hanuman is very powerful.
We remember he brought mountains and he was fighting in Lanka with big, big warriors.
He's very powerful. He's very smart.
He entered Lanka to locate Mother Sita.
He was very smart and intelligent.
He spoke extremely well. He was well-versed in Sanskrit.
And he was very satisfied being servant.
Hanuman is the servant of Lord Shri Ram.
Such a powerful, smart, intelligent person is happy being servant.
Today if I am powerful, smart, intelligent, I would like to become on my own and another leader.
What is the lesson Hanuman is teaching?
Hanuman is teaching that when you have a leader like Lord Ram, who is so glorious, who is so great,
because of his virtues and values, people love to be their servant.
Because of his virtues and values, people love to be their servant.
And be happy and satisfied being under them, being contributing under such leadership like Lord Shri Ram.
Today many leaders, they think that they need loyal, committed and contributing followers and servants.
But they need to ask question about their own self.
Am I being a worthy leader like Lord Ram to attract a worthy follower, a worthy servant like Hanuman?
The moment I am not a worthy leader like Lord Ram, who cared, who loved his followers.
Because of that, the followers were ready to offer their lives in the service of Lord Shri Ram in the war with Ravan.
That is because Ram was such an inspiring leader, who set personal examples, taking care of his own followers
and following the virtues of Lord Ram.
And he had great values and values in his personal life.
That is why Lord Shri Ram, who is a great leader, attracted great servants, great followers like Hanuman.
We always see such powerful, intelligent, smart followers like Hanuman sitting at the lotus feet of Lord Ram.
Because Lord Ram is such a great leader.
So if you want good followers, be a good leader first.
If you want some people to lead from the lotus feet of Lord Ram, share this message with your followers,
